com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_import

Interface IEnrichmentModuleContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IUnderlyingService

    public interface IEnrichmentModuleContext
extends IUnderlyingService

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode convertToMutable(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original)
      The first stage of the nicer-looking but less efficient emit process - make the input node mutable so you can edit it
      void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (All Enrichment Types) Requests that the bucket be suspended - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, String quarantine_duration)
      (All Enrichment Types) Requests that the bucket be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      void emitImmutableObject(long id, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original_json, Optional<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode> mutations, Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
      The most efficient (slightly uglier) emit process - emit the original object with a list of applied mutations

      The second stage of the nicer-looking but less efficient emit process - emit the mutated object
      Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
      (All Enrichment Types) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
      <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<String> collection, Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
      (All Enrichment Types) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state
      Future<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (All Enrichment Types) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
      String getEnrichmentContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
      (Topology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getEnrichmentContext to retrieve this class from within external clients
      <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getGlobalEnrichmentModuleObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<String> collection)
      (All Enrichment Types) Get the global (ie enrichment-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
      Optional<SharedLibraryBean> getModuleConfig()
      (All Enrichment Types) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
      long getNextUnusedId()
      Returns the next unused id, enabling new objects to be added to the enrichment processing
      IServiceContext getServiceContext()
      (HarvesterModule only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getHarvestContextLibraries) (NOTE: harvester technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
      <T> Collection<scala.Tuple2<T,String>> getTopologyEntryPoints(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage outputs objects from the harvest stage
      <T> T getTopologyErrorEndpoint(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage temporarily stores failed objects for further inspection
      <T> T getTopologyStorageEndpoint(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage stores objects coming out of the enrichment stage
      void initializeNewContext(String signature)
      (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
      void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, BasicMessageBean message)
      (All Enrichment Types) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user
      void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, BasicMessageBean message, boolean roll_up_duplicates)
      (All Enrichment Types) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined
      void storeErroredObject(long id, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original_json)
      Enables the batch process to store an object that failed for future analysis

        getUnderlyingArtefacts, getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

    • Method Detail

      • getEnrichmentContextSignature

        String getEnrichmentContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                     Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
        (Topology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getEnrichmentContext to retrieve this class from within external clients
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        an opaque string that can be passed into ContextUtils.getEnrichmentContext

      • getTopologyEntryPoints

        <T> Collection<scala.Tuple2<T,String>> getTopologyEntryPoints(Class<T> clazz,
                                                              Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage outputs objects from the harvest stage
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the requested class of the topology entry point (eg BaseRichSpout for Storm)
        bucket - - the bucket associated with this topology (if clear from the context this can be set to Optional.empty)
        Returns:
        a collection of end points of the specified type (will normally only be 1, but can be >1 for cases where an analytic technology is using an enrichment engine)

      • getTopologyStorageEndpoint

        <T> T getTopologyStorageEndpoint(Class<T> clazz,
                                 Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage stores objects coming out of the enrichment stage
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the requested class of the topology success end point (eg BaseRichBolt for Storm) - ie objects to be stored in the platform
        bucket - - the bucket associated with this topology (if clear from the context this can be set to Optional.empty)
        Returns:
        an instance of the requested class

      • getTopologyErrorEndpoint

        <T> T getTopologyErrorEndpoint(Class<T> clazz,
                               Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        For use in the topology generated by IEnrichmentStreamingTopology.getTopologyAndConfiguration - this stage temporarily stores failed objects for further inspection
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the requested class of the topology success end point (eg BaseRichBolt for Storm) - ie objects to be stored temporarily for further inspection
        bucket - - the bucket associated with this topology (if clear from the context this can be set to Optional.empty)
        Returns:
        an instance of the requested class

      • getNextUnusedId

        long getNextUnusedId()
        Returns the next unused id, enabling new objects to be added to the enrichment processing
        Returns:
        the next id that safely creates a new object

      • convertToMutable

        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode convertToMutable(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original)
        The first stage of the nicer-looking but less efficient emit process - make the input node mutable so you can edit it
        Parameters:
        original - - a JsonNode that will spawn a mutable object
        Returns:
        the mutable copy or reference of the original

      • emitMutableObject

        void emitMutableObject(long id,
                       com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode mutated_json,
                       Optional<AnnotationBean> annotation)
        The second stage of the nicer-looking but less efficient emit process - emit the mutated object
        Parameters:
        id - - the id received with the object from the EnrichmentBatchModule call (NOT USED IN STREAMING ENRICHMENT)
        mutated_json - - the mutated object to emit
        annotation - - a set of annotations to include in the emitted object

      • emitImmutableObject

        void emitImmutableObject(long id,
                         com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original_json,
                         Optional<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode> mutations,
                         Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
        The most efficient (slightly uglier) emit process - emit the original object with a list of applied mutations
        Parameters:
        id - - the id received with the object from the IEnrichmentBatchModule onObjectBatch or onAggregatedObjectBatch call (NOT USED IN STREAMING ENRICHMENT)
        original_json - - the json doc received
        mutations - - a list of "mutations" that are applied to the original_json (replace values, merge maps and sets, append collections; null value unsets)
        annotation - - a set of annotations to include in the emitted object

      • storeErroredObject

        void storeErroredObject(long id,
                        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode original_json)
        Enables the batch process to store an object that failed for future analysis
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the object received from the IEnrichmentBatchModule onObjectBatch or onAggregatedObjectBatch call (NOT USED IN STREAMING ENRICHMENT)
        original_json -

      • getServiceContext

        IServiceContext getServiceContext()
        (HarvesterModule only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getHarvestContextLibraries) (NOTE: harvester technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
        Returns:
        the service context

      • getGlobalEnrichmentModuleObjectStore

        <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getGlobalEnrichmentModuleObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                                                   Optional<String> collection)
        (All Enrichment Types) Get the global (ie enrichment-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository visible to all users of this harvest technology

      • getBucketObjectStore

        <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                         Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                         Optional<String> collection,
                                         Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
        (All Enrichment Types) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        type - - if left blank then points to the enrichment type, else can retrieve other types of object store (shared_library - bucket is then ignored, harvest, or analytics)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository

      • getBucket

        Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
        (All Enrichment Types) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
        Returns:
        The bucket that this job is running for, or Optional.empty() if that is ambiguous

      • getModuleConfig

        Optional<SharedLibraryBean> getModuleConfig()
        (All Enrichment Types) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
        Returns:
        the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed - not present if no module_id_or_name is specified for the enrichment job

      • getBucketStatus

        Future<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (All Enrichment Types) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        A Future containing a bean containing the harvests state and status

      • logStatusForBucketOwner

        void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                             BasicMessageBean message,
                             boolean roll_up_duplicates)
        (All Enrichment Types) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        The - message to log
        roll_up_duplicates - if set (default: true) then identical messages are not logged separately

      • logStatusForBucketOwner

        void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                             BasicMessageBean message)
        (All Enrichment Types) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        The - message to log (duplicates are "rolled up")

      • emergencyDisableBucket

        void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (All Enrichment Types) Requests that the bucket be suspended - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)

      • emergencyQuarantineBucket

        void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                               String quarantine_duration)
        (All Enrichment Types) Requests that the bucket be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        quarantineDuration - A string representing the duration for which to quarantine the data (eg "1 hour", "2 days", "3600")

      • initializeNewContext

        void initializeNewContext(String signature)
        (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
        Parameters:
        signature - the string returned from getEnrichmentContextSignature
